授業目的:
Social research methods are a practical knowledge structure to collect information in a systematic way, avoiding the fallacy of daily observation. As it is a practice, there are many things that it is desirable to acquire through the field. However, if basic information is not mastered in advance through classroom lectures, you may end up getting lost left and right in actual situations. In this lecture, we will learn the basics of how to handle quantitative data, from the sampling of research subjects to the writing of a paper.

　Specifically, the class will cover sampling theory and methods, how to create questionnaires and surveys, and how to edit survey data (editing, coding, data cleaning, and codebook writing).
到達目標:
The goal of this class is to have mastered the following at the end of the class.

- To be able to select the appropriate sampling method for the research topic.
- To acquire the knowledge and skills to properly conduct each sampling method.
- To acquire the knowledge and skills to appropriately prepare questionnaires.
- To acquire the skills to edit data after collecting questionnaires.
- To be able to critically evaluate existing surveys.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
